The jump range of the eagle makes it worse than a sidewinder. The weapon mounts will decrease the already ridiculously small jump range, so the eagle often gets stuck inside a few connected systems. That never happened to me in a sidewinder. Plus, the sidewinder is FREE! Yay!

Yep, a Hauler also allows you to jump from Aulin to Rakapila if you donÃ‚Â´t load it full (I think 8-9 t max) opening a totally new cluster of stars to you

I to got myself an eagle as soon as i could afford one and screwed up real bad. I thought I'd fancy myself as a pirate and decided to attack some player sidewinder around Eranin starport (foolishly thinking the police would be OK with it as long as I was outside the no-fire zone). Needless to say I was lucky to escape with my life at 15% hp when i jumped to supercruise. Fearing a galactic-wide bounty i decided to jump to freeport, since it's an anarchy system. That should have been the end of it, but foolishly i decided to stop off at an unidentified signal in the system. I couldn't believe my eyes when I jumped in to find a field of gold cannisters floating in space! Unfortunately it was to good to be true, and whilst I was occupied operating the cargo scoop, 3 pirate vipers sneaked up on me. Before I knew it I had 3 heat-seekers (rather over kill at 15% hp) on my tail and I was blown to smithereens.

Without the 2000-odd credits to pay the insurance, I got dumped back at square 1 in a sidewinder with 1k credits... there goes 10 hours gameplay

The thing with the eagle is although it's a significantly better fighter than the sidewinder, since trading is the only real way to make money in the beta it's pretty much useless.

I wouldn't say trading is the only way to make decent money; I managed to get my Eagle purely through combat missions. Accept one of the contracts that wants you to kill Federation targets and head to the Federal Distress Signal at Eranin 2. Even with one pulse laser and a Sidewinder, the Federation Condor fighters are easy pickings and you soon rack up a good few thousand credits in bounty vouchers if you stick around long enough. It worked for me so it should work for anyone

It's a good use for the Eagle, seeing as it is pretty much a dedicated fighter, but it's not for me because of my itch to go and explore what we have
